main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Jersey City, New Jersey on January 11, 1955, by a civilian witness. The observation lasted for approximately 38-40 seconds, and the object was described as a multi-colored light flashing across the horizon, fitting the description of a meteor.
interesting points: The sighting was of a ground-visual type and was reported to have lasted 38-40 seconds.
It was described as a multi-colored light flashing across the horizon, resembling a meteor.
The source of the report was a civilian witness, and no photographs were included in the report.
A separate observation by U.S. Air Force personnel in Jersey City, New Jersey, on January 6, 1955, reported a flame-red, oval-shaped object that remained in sight for 20-30 seconds.
The oval-shaped object was darker in the center, lighter on the edge, and reddish in color, and it crossed the sky at an approximate 45-degree angle before fading out of sight.
sighted object: multi-colored light flashing across the horizon, fitting the description of a meteor
witnesses: civilian witness and U.S. Air Force personnel
